intro: Vincetoxicum erianthum, commonly known as the white angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though caution is advised due to its poisonous properties.
